abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column examines investigation by FBI into relationship between Mayor Bill de Blasio's office and Joseph Dussich, owner of JAD Corporation of America, Queens-based trash bag company; FBI believes Dussich contributed money to Campaign for One New York, political advocacy group run by mayor's allies, and was subsequently given contract with parks department for sale of rat-proof garbage bags.
lead_paragraph: Legal or not, an episode involving the parks department’s purchase of mint-scented garbage bags shows the collapse of the city’s carefully constructed defenses against “pay to play” government.

headline.main: Why Trash Bags That Repel Rats Have the F.B.I. Sniffing Around in New York
headline.print_headline: Why Trash Bags That Repel Rats Have the F.B.I. Sniffing Around

snippet: Legal or not, an episode involving the parks department’s purchase of mint-scented garbage bags shows the collapse of the city’s carefully constructed defenses against “pay to play” government.
